Operator summary¶

Notes¶

  • In some cases, arguments may also be given in a different order to the one listed.
  • Block operations which require an array will implicitly call , (range) when given a number.
Op. Arguments Description Examples
! Any ! Boolean “not” 
5 !      ->  0
0 !      ->  1
"abc" !  ->  0
# Num Num # Power/exponentiation 
3 6 #   ->  729
2 .5 #  ->  1.4142135623730951
0 0 #   ->  1
Array Any # Find index, or -1 if not present 
"abcde" 'b #   ->  1
[1 2 3 4] 5 #  ->  -1
$ Int $ Copy from stack 
Suppose stack is ["abc" -4 3]:

  0 $   ->  3
  1 $   ->  -4
  2 $   ->  "abc"
  -1 $  ->  "abc"
Array $ Sort 
[3 0 2 1] $  ->  [0 1 2 3]
% Num Num % Modulo 
27 5 %  ->  2
Array Num % Every nth 
[0 1 2 3 4] 2 %  ->  [0 2 4]
[0 1 2 3 4] 3 %  ->  [0 3]

String Char %

Array Array %

 Split by 
"1,2,3" ', %    ->  ["1" "2" "3"]
"abcde" "bc" %  ->  ["a" "de"]
[1 2 3] [2] %   ->  [[1] [3]]
Array Block % Map 
[1 2 3] {2*3+} %  ->  [5 7 9]
&

Int Int &

Int Char &

 Bitwise “and” 
5 6 &  ->  4
Array Any & Setwise intersection 
[6 1 8 1] [6 1 1 2] &  ->  [6 1]
"abcde" 'f &           ->  ""
(

Num (

Char (

 Decrement 
42 (   ->  41
'b (   ->  'a
Array ( Uncons from left 
[2 7 1 8] (  ->  [7 1 8] 2
)

Num )

Char )

 Increment 
42 )   ->  43
'b )   ->  'c
Array ) Uncons from right 
[2 7 1 8] )  ->  [2 7 1] 8
